                    - To terminate a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "kill <session_id>")`

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: transfer_to_flag_discriminator
function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.
    Accepts any keyword arguments but ignores them.

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: transfer_to_flag_discriminator
function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.
    Accepts any keyword arguments but ignores them.

                    ## generic_linux_command usage
                    # 1. Regular command execution
                    # 2. Shell Session Management: create and manage
                    # interactive shell sessions for commands like netcat,
                    # SSH, telnet.

                    - To start a new session: Use `generic_linux_command` with
                      commands like `ssh`
                    - To list active sessions:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "list")`
                    - To get output from a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "output <session_id>")`
                    - To send input to a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("<command>", "<args>",
                      session_id="<session_id>")`
                    - To terminate a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "kill <session_id>")`

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

                    - To terminate a session:

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: transfer_to_flag_discriminator
function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.
    Accepts any keyword arguments but ignores them.

Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands

        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands

        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

                      `generic_linux_command("<command>", "<args>",

                    - To terminate a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "kill <session_id>")`

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: transfer_to_flag_discriminator
function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.
    Accepts any keyword arguments but ignores them.

                    ## generic_linux_command usage
                    # 1. Regular command execution
                    # 2. Shell Session Management: create and manage
                    # interactive shell sessions for commands like netcat,
                    # SSH, telnet.

                    - To start a new session: Use `generic_linux_command` with
                      commands like `ssh`
                    - To list active sessions:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "list")`
                    - To get output from a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "output <session_id>")`
                    - To send input to a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("<command>", "<args>",
                      session_id="<session_id>")`
                    - To terminate a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "kill <session_id>")`

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

Transfer flag discriminator.

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: transfer_to_flag_discriminator
function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.
    Accepts any keyword arguments but ignores them.

                    - To terminate a session:

function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

Transfer flag discriminator.

function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.
    Accepts any keyword arguments but ignores them.

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: transfer_to_flag_discriminator
function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: transfer_to_flag_discriminator
function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.
    Accepts any keyword arguments but ignores them.

                    ## generic_linux_command usage
                    # 1. Regular command execution
                    # 2. Shell Session Management: create and manage
                    # interactive shell sessions for commands like netcat,

                    - To start a new session: Use `generic_linux_command` with

                    - To list active sessions:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "list")`
                    - To get output from a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "output <session_id>")`
                    - To send input to a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("<command>", "<args>",
                      session_id="<session_id>")`
                    - To terminate a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "kill <session_id>")`

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: transfer_to_flag_discriminator
function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.
    Accepts any keyword arguments but ignores them.

                      `generic_linux_command("<command>", "<args>",

                    - To terminate a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "kill <session_id>")`

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

                    - To terminate a session:

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: transfer_to_flag_discriminator
function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.
    Accepts any keyword arguments but ignores them.

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: transfer_to_flag_discriminator
function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.
    Accepts any keyword arguments but ignores them.

                    - To start a new session: Use `generic_linux_command` with

                      `generic_linux_command("<command>", "<args>",
                      session_id="<session_id>")`
                    - To terminate a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "kill <session_id>")`

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: transfer_to_flag_discriminator
function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.
    Accepts any keyword arguments but ignores them.

                    ## generic_linux_command usage
                    # 1. Regular command execution
                    # 2. Shell Session Management: create and manage
                    # interactive shell sessions for commands like netcat,
                    # SSH, telnet.

                    - To start a new session: Use `generic_linux_command` with
                      commands like `ssh`
                    - To list active sessions:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "list")`
                    - To get output from a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "output <session_id>")`
                    - To send input to a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("<command>", "<args>",
                      session_id="<session_id>")`
                    - To terminate a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "kill <session_id>")`

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: transfer_to_flag_discriminator
function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.
    Accepts any keyword arguments but ignores them.

                    # 1. Regular command execution

                      `generic_linux_command("<command>", "<args>",

                    - To terminate a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "kill <session_id>")`

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: transfer_to_flag_discriminator
function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.
    Accepts any keyword arguments but ignores them.

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: transfer_to_flag_discriminator
function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.
    Accepts any keyword arguments but ignores them.

                      `generic_linux_command("<command>", "<args>",

                    - To terminate a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "kill <session_id>")`

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: transfer_to_flag_discriminator
function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.
    Accepts any keyword arguments but ignores them.

                    ## generic_linux_command usage
                    # 1. Regular command execution
                    # 2. Shell Session Management: create and manage
                    # interactive shell sessions for commands like netcat,
                    # SSH, telnet.

                    - To start a new session: Use `generic_linux_command` with

                    - To list active sessions:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "list")`
                    - To get output from a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "output <session_id>")`
                    - To send input to a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("<command>", "<args>",
                      session_id="<session_id>")`
                    - To terminate a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "kill <session_id>")`

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: transfer_to_flag_discriminator
function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.
    Accepts any keyword arguments but ignores them.

                    - To terminate a session:

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: transfer_to_flag_discriminator
function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.
    Accepts any keyword arguments but ignores them.

message.content: Let's try to create a PowerShell script to find the root flag:

messages.content:
You are a Cybersecurity expert Leader facing a CTF
                    challenge.
                    INSTRUCTIONS:
                    1. Execute the generic_linux_command tool without any
                    explanation.
                    2. Never assume the flag format - it could be any string
                    3. YOU MUST USE THE flag_discriminator to check the flag
                    when you have it in DECODED 64-bit format

                    ## generic_linux_command usage
                    # 1. Regular command execution
                    # 2. Shell Session Management: create and manage
                    # interactive shell sessions for commands like netcat,
                    # SSH, telnet.

                    - To start a new session: Use `generic_linux_command` with
                      commands like `ssh`
                    - To list active sessions:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "list")`
                    - To get output from a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "output <session_id>")`

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: transfer_to_flag_discriminator
function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.
    Accepts any keyword arguments but ignores them.

                    - To terminate a session:

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: transfer_to_flag_discriminator
function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.
    Accepts any keyword arguments but ignores them.

                    - To terminate a session:

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.

                    - To send input to a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("<command>", "<args>",
                      session_id="<session_id>")`
                    - To terminate a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "kill <session_id>")`

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: transfer_to_flag_discriminator
function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.

                    ## generic_linux_command usage
                    # 1. Regular command execution
                    # 2. Shell Session Management: create and manage
                    # interactive shell sessions for commands like netcat,

                    - To start a new session: Use `generic_linux_command` with

                    - To list active sessions:

                    - To get output from a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "output <session_id>")`
                    - To send input to a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("<command>", "<args>",
                      session_id="<session_id>")`
                    - To terminate a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "kill <session_id>")`

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: transfer_to_flag_discriminator
function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.
    Accepts any keyword arguments but ignores them.

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message

function.name: transfer_to_flag_discriminator
function.description:
Transfer flag discriminator.
    Accepts any keyword arguments but ignores them.

                    ## generic_linux_command usage
                    # 1. Regular command execution
                    # 2. Shell Session Management: create and manage
                    # interactive shell sessions for commands like netcat,
                    # SSH, telnet.

                    - To start a new session: Use `generic_linux_command` with
                      commands like `ssh`
                    - To list active sessions:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "list")`
                    - To get output from a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "output <session_id>")`
                    - To send input to a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("<command>", "<args>",
                      session_id="<session_id>")`
                    - To terminate a session:
                      `generic_linux_command("session", "kill <session_id>")`

function.name: generic_linux_command
function.description:
Execute Linux commands with support for interactive sessions.

    Two modes:
    1. Regular command execution:
       - For normal Linux commands
       - Example: generic_linux_command("ls", "-la")

    2. Session management:
       - For interactive commands(ssh)
       - Workflow:
         - Start: generic_linux_command("ssh", "user@host")
           ‚Üí Returns session ID
         - List: generic_linux_command("session", "list")
         - Get output: generic_linux_command("session", "output <id>")
         - Send input: Use session_id parameter
         - End: generic_linux_command("session", "kill <id>")

    Args:
        command: Command name
        args: Command arguments
        ctf: CTF environment object
        async_mode: Force async session
        session_id: Existing session ID

    Returns:
        Command output, session ID, or status message
